description: ### Purpose

The InvokeForEachLoop plugin finds all elements matching your locator and runs a set of actions on each one. By default, nested actions apply to those found elements, so you do not need to specify `locator` or `onElement` on each rule. To target different elements inside the loop, include `locator` and `onElement` in the action's rule. It also supports nested loops for multi‑level workflows, making repetitive RPA and testing tasks straightforward to automate.
### Key Features and Functionality
| Feature                     | Description                                                                                       |
| Element Iteration           | Finds all elements matching the locator and loops through each one without extra configuration.   |
| Default Context Binding     | Applies all nested actions to the loop's element set by default, so you can omit locator details. |
| Alternative Locator Support | Lets you specify a different locator and onElement to run actions on other elements.              |
| Sequential Execution        | Runs actions in order on each element for a clear, predictable workflow.                          |
| Nested Loop Capability      | Allows loops inside loops for multi‑level, hierarchical processing.                               |
### Usages in RPA
| Use Case           | Description                                                                                           |
| Data Processing    | Process each item in a list by running data entry, validation, or transformation without extra setup. |
| Batch Operations   | Perform ordered tasks on groups of files, records, or transactions using a single loop definition.    |
| Dynamic Interaction| Automate UI items created at runtime by clicking, typing, or checking content on each found element.  |
### Usages in Automation Testing
| Use Case             | Description                                                                                             |
| Element Verification | Check each UI element's state or value against expectations without repeating locator settings.         |
| Data‑Driven Testing  | Loop through data sets and run tests with varying inputs by only defining the loop once.                |
| UI Interaction       | Simulate user workflows like clicks or form entries on each element in a consistent, repeatable manner. |
Specifies the locator strategy to find the web elements to be iterated. Supported locator types include `CssSelector`, `XPath`, `LinkText`, etc.
properties.name: Locator

description: Specifies the locator used to find the elements that the loop will iterate over.
This property is mandatory and defines how the plugin identifies the collection of elements to process.
properties.name: OnElement

description: Defines a sequence of actions or instructions to be executed on each element found by the locator.
Each action can interact with the current element or use an alternative locator as needed.
properties.name: Rules

summary: The `InvokeForEachLoop` plugin enables efficient iteration over elements identified by a specified locator.
It allows automation scripts to execute a series of actions on each element sequentially, supporting complex workflows with nested loops.
Key use cases include data processing, dynamic UI interactions in RPA, and comprehensive automation testing scenarios.
